verses.roman:
iti mūḍhaḥ pratijñāya
devaṁ paśu-patiṁ prabhum
ārādhayām āsa nṛpaḥ
pāṁśu-muṣṭiṁ sakṛd grasan

synonyms: iti—with these words; mūḍhaḥ—the fool; pratijñāya—having vowed; devam—the lord; paśu-patim—Śiva, the protector of animallike men; prabhum—his master; āradhayām āsa—worshiped; nṛpaḥ—the King; pāṁśu—of dust; muṣṭim—a handful; sakṛt—once (daily); grasan—eating.
translation: Having thus made his vow, the foolish King proceeded to worship Lord Paśupati [Śiva] as his deity by eating a handful of dust each day, and nothing more.
